core.planner
Class Literal

java.lang.Object
  java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      java.util.AbstractList<E>
          java.util.ArrayList<Term>
              core.planner.Atom
                  core.planner.Literal
All Implemented Interfaces:
Standardizable, Substituable, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<Term>, java.util.Collection<Term>, java.util.List<Term>, java.util.RandomAccess
public final class Literal
extends Atom

The Literal class implements a literal which is any of the folowing: a logical atom a; an expression of the form (not a) where a is a logical atom (the intended meaning is that the expression is true if a is false).

See Also:

unify

public Substitution unify(Atom a)
                   throws UnificationException
Returns the most general unifier of two literals. Prior binding variables contained in the Substitution parameter are considered.

Specified by:
unify in class Atom
Parameters:
a - the first Literal to unify.
Returns:
the most general unifier or null if it does not exist. An empty mgu means that there is no binding Variable between this and a.
Throws:
UnificationException - if a is not an instance of Literal.

unify

public Substitution unify(Atom a,
                          Substitution alpha)
                   throws UnificationException
Returns the most general unifier of two literals. Prior binding variables contained in the Substitution parameter are considered.

Specified by:
unify in class Atom
Parameters:
a - the first Literal to unify.
alpha - the prior binding variables.
Returns:
the most general unifier or null if it does not exist. An empty mgu means that there is no binding Variable between this and a.
Throws:
UnificationException - if a is not an instance of Literal.

applySubstitution

public java.lang.Object applySubstitution(Substitution alpha,
                                          boolean replaceVar)
                                   throws SubstitutionException
Returns a new Literal such that the variables appearing in the Substitution are replaced with the corresponding Term of the Susbstitution.

Parameters:
alpha - the Substitution to apply.
replaceVar - flag to indicate if the Substitution allows to instantiate Variable s not in the Substitution by a Constant with the Variable name.
Returns:
a substituted copy of the Literal.
Throws:
SubstitutionException - if an error occur during substitution.
